channel.title: Just found my
channel.description:
R-Zone, Pokemon Card collection (about 700 I think + I have never bought any cards, I started out with 1 card and worked my way up on elementary school about 7 years ago) and Yu-Gi-Oh card collection.
[img]http://img231.imageshack.us/img231/8040/imagesaspximg1110817132.jpg[/img]
What about you, got any of these?
I'm going to look how much the street price of these are, these are the retro old cards from 1995-2000.

item.title: Just found my
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

Could do something with this game:

Yu-Gi-Oh!

Yu-Gi-Oh! Power of Chaos: Joey the Passion

Yu-Gi-Oh! Power of Chaos: Joey the Passion is the third Yu-Gi-Oh! game for PC. It is also the final game of the Power of Chaos game series. The game features 771 cards, including 234 new cards and 466 cards which were introduced in the previous two...


We should have a hamachi network where we all join. Ofc. this game is obviously outdated in terms of cards, and sadly does not contain the god cards, but imo. the game was pretty epic. Also I guess we could play the GBA versions over LAN (there’s a VBA version that supports this!). There should be other options but I didn’t look into them all.

Read full topic

item.title: Just found my
item.dc:creator: @SETO SETO
item.description:
@SETO wrote:

[quote=“ollie123, post:43, topic:410705”][quote author=SETO link=topic=511982.msg3717143#msg3717143 date=1313708976]
back in 2004, i used to buy 50 cards for $1.00, they are random and if you are lucky you get some rare. Blue eyes, Red eyes, Dark magician were $0.50 ea, But at the store they were expensive. the kid who sells them had an uncle who owns a games shop.

Yu-gi-oh was popular in grade 7-8 after that no one really played it and I still have a deck of about ~ 1000 cards [almost $20].
I never got into pokemon tho…but loved dungeon dice

[/quote]

Oh yeah, I had both versions of Dark Magician aswell as the Sphinx cards, they were pretty good (of course their were better, etc).[/quote]
around that time 04, i think the powerful card in yugioh was blue eyes, then dark magician with the dark sword

Read full topic

Yu-gi-oh was popular in grade 7-8 after that no one really played it and I still have a deck of about ~ 1000 cards [almost $20].

item.title: Just found my
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

shrogg:

Anyone play Magic the gathering?

I have a Knight and Dragon deck. But I need a few more cards to make it even more utter bullshit.

A good field I could have is.

2X Knight Exemplar, Kinsbaile Cavalier, Kabira Vindicator, Knotvine Paladin.

Then have a War Reports and Day of Judgement in my hand, gf your field and then take a shit load to the face.
